It is away from Cairo. The city is located in the Faiyum Oasis, and it is the capital of Faiyum Governorate. The city was called Shedet in Ancient Egypt. When the Greeks took Egypt, they called it Crocodilopolis or Krocodilopolis. the Romans called it Arsinoë. It is one of Egypt's oldest cities, and it has a strategic location. ==Climate== == Main sights == * Hawara, archeological site from the city * Lahun Pyramids, outside the city * Qaitbay Mosque, in the city. the wife of the Mamluk Sultan Qaitbay built it. * Qasr Qarun, from the city * Wadi Elrayan or Wadi Rayan, the largest waterfalls in Egypt, around from the city * Wadi Al-Hitan or Valley of whales, It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. == Images == File:QasrQarunFacade.jpg|Qarun Palace File:UmmAtlTemple1.jpg|Temple File:Whale skeleton 2.jpg|A whale skeleton at Wadi Al-Hitan (Arabic: وادي الحيتان, "Whales Valley") near Faiyum == Related pages == * Faiyum Governorate * Wadi Elrayan == References == == Other websites == * * * Fayum towns and their papyri, edited with translations and notes by Bernard P. Grenfell and Arthur S. Hunt at the Internet Archive * . 148 pages, public domain. * Fayoum Photo Gallery Category:Cities in Egypt
title: Faiyum
